title: Episode 246 | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Primary source for episode information including title, air dates, plot summary, and trivia. Provided details about the episode being the first to use 'Dear Friends' as ending and TV ratings.

title: Rob Lucci | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Source for Rob Lucci's character information, voice actors (Tomokazu Seki in Japanese, Jason Liebrecht in English), CP9 role, and Devil Fruit details.

title: Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Comprehensive information about Lucci's Devil Fruit including type, debut episode/chapter, abilities, strengths, weaknesses, and how it combines with Rokushiki techniques.

title: Rokushiki | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Source for information about Rokushiki techniques, specifically Rankyaku (Storm Leg) used by Lucci to bisect the Galley-La headquarters.

title: CP9 | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Information about Cipher Pol Number 9, its members, their roles, and their mission to obtain the Pluton blueprints.

title: Klabautermann | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Source for information about the Klabautermann ship spirit concept that Franky explains to Usopp, including its German maritime folklore origins.

title: Kokoro no Chizu | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Information about the opening song 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE used in episodes 207-263.

title: Dear Friends | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Information about the ending song 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE, confirming Episode 246 as the first to use this ending and that the song is dedicated to Going Merry.

title: Chapter 349 | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Source for manga chapter information corresponding to Episode 246, including Lucci's Rankyaku destroying the upper levels of Galley-La headquarters.

title: Chapter 350 | One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Source for manga chapter information corresponding to Episode 246, including CP9's search for Franky's location.

title: Franky Voice - One Piece | Behind The Voice Actors
author: BTVA Community
notes: Source for Franky's voice actors: Kazuki Yao (Japanese, original) and Patrick Seitz (English). Note: Kazuki Yao was replaced by Subaru Kimura in late 2024 due to health reasons.
